result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Deshae Saulsberry

records.addlTxt: Court ORDERS Defendant turned over to Justice Point with Level 5 Supervision. The Court ordered defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  The Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. The Court ordered defendant to undergo random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test. No possession of firearms or dangerous weapons.

Defendant Antonio Deshae Saulsberry in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Antonio Deshae Saulsberry.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court ORDERS Defendant turned over to Justice Point with Level 5 Supervision, with conditions.  Case adjourned to Branch 9 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Deshae Saulsberry in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Antonio Deshae Saulsberry.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea Hearing.  Discussion held regarding possible new case being filed. Defense unable to proceed with plea at this time and requests adjourned Plea hearing be set. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Deshae Saulsberry in court with attorney Conner Helvig.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for continued Pretrial Conference.  Defense has received discovery from the state and is reviewing possible plea offer with Defendant.  Defense requests Plea hearing. 
Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Deshae Saulsberry in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Findling appeared and was excused by the Court. Court sets the following deadlines.
- 06/24/22: deadline for parties to confirm all discovery has been sent with the exception of crime lab reports.
- 07/22/22: deadline for filing motions.
- 08/05/22: deadline for filing change of plea forms.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Case is adjourned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 056531,
Payable Number: 1013896,
Receipt Number: 22RP024460,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Antonio Deshae Saulsberry in court with attorney Jason A Findling via Zoom.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense reports that the defendant is going to be hiring private counsel. Defense requested an adjournment to allow time for the defendant to obtain private counsel. Court grants defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
DNA Notice of Intent to Use_1 - Saulsberry, Antonio Deshae.pdf, Filed.

Defendant Antonio Deshae Saulsberry in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties before the court for scheduling.  Court set deadline for State to provide Discovery (with the exception of crime lab report), to 4/29  the deadline to file motions or if there is a change of  plea, all paperwork should be filed by 5/31; The next court appearance in Br 17 will be for a continued pre trial conference.  mn  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Antonio Deshae Saulsberry in court with Attorney Jason A Findling; both appear by video.  Matthew Zisi appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF4787. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Ayala. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio Deshae Saulsberry in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/22 @ 1p
